data.title: Links :: Thunder Bay Hiking Association
data.text:
Links

Hiking Clubs, Associations and Conservation Groups

Hike Canada

Canada's National Hiking Organization Since 1971. Piece by piece, the scenic 10,000 kilometre foot trail is growing to connect the Atlantic to the Pacific.

http://www.hikecanada.org

Hike Ontario

Hike Ontario, founded in 1974, is a non-profit organization dedicated to serving the needs of all hikers and walkers in the Province of Ontario .

http://www.hikeontario.com

Superior Country

Whether you’re climbing the Sleeping Giant, visiting the City of Thunder Bay, camping on a remote lake or trolling for the big one on Lake Nipigon, we’ll offer you a true taste of everything great in Superior Country. Catch the Superior spirit and soothe your soul.

https://superiorcountry.ca/

Ontario Trails Council

A charity that promotes the development, preservation, management and use of recreational trails in Ontario.

http://www.ontariotrails.on.ca

Out There

Canada's largest website for outdoor enthusiasts. Launched in 1995, Out There lists clubs, stores, events, tours, parks as well as information on specific outdoor activities such as camping and rafting.

http://www.out-there.com

The Trans Canada Trail

a 21,500-kilometre recreational trail winding its way through every province and territory, from the Atlantic to Pacific to Arctic Oceans.

http://www.tctrail.ca

Lappe Nordic Ski Club

Recreation, Fitness, Skill Development and Racing

https://www.lappenordic.ca/

Thunder Bay Nordic Trails

Thunder Bay Nordic Trails (TBNT) is a not-for-profit association of dedicated cross country skiers that maintains over 100 kms of trails in the Thunder Bay region. These trails include 30 kms at Kamview Nordic Centre, 60 kms at Sleeping Giant Provincial Park and 13 kms at Kakabeka Falls Provincial Park.

http://www.tbnordictrails.com

Trowbridge Forest Multi-Use Recreation Trail System

https://www.blacksheepmtb.com/trails

Voyageur Trail Association

The intent of the Voyageur Trail system is to build and maintain a hiking trail from Thunder Bay to join up with trails in southern Ontario via the Sudbury region.

http://www.voyageurtrail.ca

Path of the paddle

To develop the 1200 Km Path of the Paddle canoe/kayak route into a sustainable experiential tourism product representative of culture and history of the region through cooperative marketing programs, initiative specific promotional products and diverse partnerships.

http://www.pathofthepaddleassociation.com

Thunder Bay Field Naturalists

TBFN is dedicated to the study of natural history, wise use of natural resources, preservation of natural areas, and understanding and protection of nature

http://www.tbfn.net

Nature Conservancy of Canada

The Nature Conservancy of Canada (NCC) is the nation’s leading not-for-profit, private land conservation organization, working to protect our most important natural areas and the species they sustain. To learn more, visit

natureconservancy.ca.

Lakehead Regional Conservation Authority

The Lakehead Region Conservation Authority (LRCA) is a community-based environmental agency that provides value-added services to our watershed residents. We are responsible for the wise management of renewable natural resources in our watershed. Conservation Authorities undertake a broad range of programs, including: watershed management, erosion control, flood forecasting & warning, recreation, water level monitoring, plan input & review, environmental education and stewardship. We improve quality of life by actively providing Conservation Areas for semi-passive recreation and environmental education opportunities.

https://lakeheadca.com/

PARKS (NORTHWESTERN ONTARIO)

Aaron

Kakabeka Falls

MacLeod

Neys

Ojibway

Sandbar Lake

Sleeping Giant

Wabakimi

White Lake

Ouimet Canyon

Pigeon River

Quetico

Rainbow Falls

American Trails

The only national (USA), nonprofit organization working on behalf of all trail interests, including hiking, bicycling, mountain biking, horseback riding, water trails, snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, trail motorcycling, ATVs, snowmobiling and four-wheeling.

http://www.americantrails.org

PARKS (NORTHERN MINNESOTA)
